001// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-3.0-or-later
002
003package es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.corenlpentityextraction;
004
005import java.io.Closeable;
006import java.io.IOException;
007import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
008import java.nio.file.Path;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.Locale;
011import java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue;
012import java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;
013import java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue;
014
015import org.apache.commons.csv.CSVFormat;
016import org.apache.commons.csv.CSVPrinter;
017
018import edu.stanford.nlp.pipeline.TokensRegexNERAnnotator;
019import es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.step.util.VariableHolder;
020import lombok.NonNull;
021
022/**
023 * Writes NER mappings to a file, in the format specified by
024 * {@link TokensRegexNERAnnotator}.
025 * <p>
026 * This class is designed to be used by several threads in parallel, and it is
027 * responsible for serializing writes to the resulting file. Therefore, write
028 * calls may block.
029 * </p>
030 *
031 * @author Alejandro González García
032 */
033final class NERMappingsFileWriter implements Closeable {
034        private static final CSVFormat NER_MAPPINGS_FILE_FORMAT;
035
036        private final BlockingQueue<Object[]> recordQueue = new SynchronousQueue<>();
037        private final BlockingQueue<VariableHolder<IOException>> resultQueue = new SynchronousQueue<>();
038        private final Thread recordWriterThread;
039        private volatile boolean closed = false;
040
041        static {
042                // The format for TokensRegexNERAnnotator files, which essentially is TSV
043                NER_MAPPINGS_FILE_FORMAT = CSVFormat.TDF
044                        .withRecordSeparator('\n')
045                        .withTrim()
046                        .withHeader(MappingsFileFields.class)
047                        .withSkipHeaderRecord()
048                        .withIgnoreEmptyLines();
049        }
050
051        /**
052         * Creates a new NER mappings file writer.
053         *
054         * @param mappingsFile The file path that will contain the mappings.
055         * @throws IOException              If an I/O error occurs during
056         *                                  initialization.
057         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code mappingsFile} is {@code null}.
058         */
059        NERMappingsFileWriter(@NonNull final Path mappingsFile) throws IOException {
060                final CSVPrinter csvPrinter = NER_MAPPINGS_FILE_FORMAT.print(mappingsFile, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
061                final CountDownLatch recordWriterThreadReady = new CountDownLatch(1);
062
063                this.recordWriterThread = new Thread(() -> {
064                        try {
065                                while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
066                                        recordWriterThreadReady.countDown();
067
068                                        final Object[] record = recordQueue.take();
069                                        IOException writeException = null;
070
071                                        try {
072                                                csvPrinter.printRecord(record);
073                                                try {
074                                                        csvPrinter.flush();
075                                                } catch (final IOException ignored) {}
076                                        } catch (final Exception exc) {
077                                                // Capture every exception type, just in case
078                                                writeException = exc instanceof IOException ?
079                                                        (IOException) exc : new IOException(exc);
080                                        } finally {
081                                                boolean resultHandedOff = false;
082                                                while (!resultHandedOff) {
083                                                        try {
084                                                                resultQueue.put(new VariableHolder<>(writeException));
085                                                                resultHandedOff = true;
086                                                        } catch (final InterruptedException ignored) {
087                                                                // We must hand off the result. Just record
088                                                                // the interrupt status to exit the loop later.
089                                                                // We can't hang the producers
090                                                                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
091                                                        }
092                                                }
093                                        }
094                                }
095                        } catch (InterruptedException bailOut) {
096                        } finally {
097                                try {
098                                        csvPrinter.close();
099                                } catch (final IOException ignored) {
100                                        // Not much can be done to handle this
101                                }
102                        }
103                }, "NER mapping file record writer thread");
104
105                recordWriterThread.setDaemon(true);
106                recordWriterThread.setPriority(Thread.MIN_PRIORITY);
107                recordWriterThread.start();
108
109                // Wait until the record writer thread is ready to write records.
110                // Consider not being able to guarantee that as an I/O error
111                try {
112                        recordWriterThreadReady.await();
113                } catch (final InterruptedException exc) {
114                        throw new IOException(exc);
115                }
116        }
117
118        /**
119         * Writes the specified named entity mapping to the named entity mappings file
120         * associated to this writer, with a priority of 0.
121         *
122         * @param token             The token to add a mapping to. It will be
123         *                          interpreted as a Java regular expression. Empty
124         *                          tokens will be ignored and not written to the file.
125         * @param type              The label of the named entity type the named entity
126         *                          identified by the token belongs to.
127         * @param overwritableTypes A list of named entity types that this mapping is
128         *                          able to override. This list can be empty.
129         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If any parameter is {@code null}, or
130         *                                  {@code overwritableTypes} contains a
131         *                                  {@code null} element.
132         * @throws IOException              If an I/O error occurs during the operation,
133         *                                  or the writer is closed.
134         */
135        public void writeMapping(
136                @NonNull final String token, @NonNull final String type, @NonNull final List<String> overwritableTypes
137        ) throws IOException {
138                writeMapping(token, type, overwritableTypes, 0);
139        }
140
141        /**
142         * Writes the specified named entity mapping to the named entity mappings file
143         * associated to this writer.
144         *
145         * @param token             The token to add a mapping to. It will be
146         *                          interpreted as a Java regular expression. Empty
147         *                          tokens will be ignored and not written to the file.
148         * @param type              The label of the named entity type the named entity
149         *                          identified by the token belongs to.
150         * @param overwritableTypes A list of named entity types that this mapping is
151         *                          able to override. This list can be empty.
152         * @param priority          The priority of this mapping. Higher values take
153         *                          precendence.
154         * @throws IllegalArgumentException If any parameter is {@code null}, or
155         *                                  {@code overwritableTypes} contains a
156         *                                  {@code null} element.
157         * @throws IOException              If an I/O error occurs during the operation,
158         *                                  or the writer is closed.
159         */
160        public void writeMapping(
161                @NonNull final String token, @NonNull final String type, @NonNull final List<String> overwritableTypes,
162                final int priority
163        ) throws IOException {
164                final StringBuilder overwritableTypesStringBuilder = new StringBuilder();
165                IOException writeException = null;
166
167                if (closed) {
168                        throw new IOException("Can't write NER mappings to a closed writer");
169                }
170
171                for (final String overwritableType : overwritableTypes) {
172                        if (overwritableType == null) {
173                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("A named entity type can't be null");
174                        }
175
176                        overwritableTypesStringBuilder.append(overwritableType);
177                        overwritableTypesStringBuilder.append(',');
178                }
179
180                // Delete trailing comma
181                if (overwritableTypesStringBuilder.length() > 0) {
182                        overwritableTypesStringBuilder.setLength(overwritableTypesStringBuilder.length() - 1);
183                }
184
185                if (!token.isBlank()) {
186                        try {
187                                recordQueue.put(
188                                        new Object[] {
189                                                token, type.toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT),
190                                                overwritableTypesStringBuilder.toString(),
191                                                priority
192                                        }
193                                );
194
195                                // No two threads can be waiting for a result at the same time,
196                                // because the put call above acts like a mutex: we can't reach
197                                // this take call without putting before, and we can't put before
198                                // the writer thread puts the result for us
199                                boolean tookResult = false;
200                                while (!tookResult) {
201                                        try {
202                                                writeException = resultQueue.take().getVariable();
203                                                tookResult = true;
204                                        } catch (final InterruptedException ignored) {
205                                                // Take the result no matter what. We can't retreat
206                                                // once the record is submitted, or the writer thread
207                                                // will hang
208                                        }
209                                }
210
211                                if (writeException != null) {
212                                        throw writeException;
213                                }
214                        } catch (final InterruptedException bailOut) {}
215                }
216        }
217
218        /**
219         * @implNote This implementation never throws an exception. Any error which
220         *           occurs closing resources is silently ignored.
221         */
222        @Override
223        public void close() throws IOException {
224                closed = true;
225                recordWriterThread.interrupt();
226        }
227
228        /**
229         * Represents the fields that each record in a NER mappings file can contain.
230         *
231         * @author Alejandro González García
232         */
233        private static enum MappingsFileFields {
234                /**
235                 * A sequence of Java regular expressions that will be applied to a tokenized
236                 * input document. The matches will be considered instances of a named entity.
237                 */
238                TOKEN_REGEX,
239                /**
240                 * The named entity type (label) for the matched token.
241                 */
242                TYPE,
243                /**
244                 * The named entity types this match can override.
245                 */
246                OVERWRITABLE_TYPES,
247                /**
248                 * The priority of the match 
249                 */
250                PRIORITY;
251
252                @Override
253                public String toString() {
254                        return name().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
255                }
256        }
257}
